topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Removing an Existing Cluster from the Compute Resource Pool

body.p:
Perform the following steps to remove an existing cluster from the compute resource pool requires:
Execute the following command to check for the instances launched in that cluster.# nova list --host <hostname> +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+ | ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks | +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+ | 80e54965-758b-425e-901b-9ea756576331 | HLM-VM1 | ACTIVE | - | Running | private=10.0.0.2 | +--------------------------------------+---------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
where:
hostname: hostname of the compute proxy present in that cluster.
Delete all instances spawned in that cluster.# nova delete <server> [<server ...>]
where:
server: name or ID of server (s)
OR
Migrate all instances spawned in that cluster.# nova migrate <server>
Execute the following command to deactivate a cluster. # eon cluster-deactivate --vcenter-id <vCenter ID> --cluster-moid <Cluster Moid>
where:
vCenter ID: ID of the vCenter containing the cluster.
Commit your configuration cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"
Run the configuration processoransible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e remove_deleted_servers="y" -e free_unused_addresses="y"
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml ( this is already available )
Execute the following command to unimport cluster on the respective cluster# eon cluster-unimport --vcenter-id <vCenter ID> --cluster-moid <Cluster Moid>
Do not execute osconfig-run.yml or hlm-deploy.yml playbooks.
